content: We are going to use this streaming to track meeting links, agendas and other stuff.

:wave::wave::wave::wave::wave::wave:

Please proposal topics for August meeting (8.5)

Topics :

 - New Feature - "Core Module Dynamic Linking":
   - What do you think about the idea of dynamically linking core modules?
   - Are there specific features or capabilities you'd like to see?
   - How do you think this should be designed to fit into your projects?
 - Feedback on WASI P2 Module:
   - We're gathering feedback on the WASI P2 module. What are your needs or thoughts on this?
   - Are there specific features or capabilities you'd like to see?
 - Toolkit Upgrades Coming Up:
   - We're planning to upgrade our toolkits soon. Do you have any concerns or special requirements we should consider?
 - Wishlist for New Features. Includes memory64(for AOT and/or fast-interprter), table64, multi-memory(for AOT and/or    fast-interpreter)
   - Which new features are you hoping for?
   - Share any specific requirements or ideas you have for future development.
 - Shared Heap Feature
   - We're making headway with the shared heap feature. If you have any ideas or needs related to this, we're all ears.

+1 to "Core Module Dynamic Linking"; as per the discussion last month, I've opened the ticket https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime/issues/3678 to start gathering the requirements, we'll also publish the design there once it's ready.

[RFC] Core module Dynamic Linking · Issue #3678 · bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime
Feature This feature is to enable dynamic linking and dynamic loading of shared objects in WAMR. The feature enables: loading modules compiled to WebAssembly once, but re-use symbols by dependent m...
+1 to wasi p2 or "components" and mem64, def

I've opened an issue https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime/issues/3685 to start gathering the requirements and comments about the idea to support wasm32-wasi-p2-module,.

[RFC] wasm32-wasi-p2-module · Issue #3685 · bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime
wasm32-wasi-p2-module, or wasm32-wasi-t2, is a new concept highlighted in a slide in Wasm CG June 2024. The initial idea can be found in a discussion. P2-module is expected to enhance core modules ...
